result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Eugene Sevelin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Eugene Sevelin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Eugene Sevelin was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Mark Eugene Sevelin appeared. Case called at 3:01. Atty. Kucinski updates the court. ADA Hartung agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC  to Ct 1 in 15CM442. DE sworn. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM442. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM442. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
-- Costs of $443.00
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-06-2016 04:00 pm

Pre-trial conference at 09-18-2015 08:45 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David L. or his residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
